data.title: Russia – Page 441 – POLITICO
data.meta_description: Latest politics, government and election news for Russia
data.text:
9 March Meeting of Contact Group on former Yugoslavia

FIVE members of the six-nation Contact Group of powerful countries agreed to halt financial aid to Serbia, impose an arms embargo, ban sales of equipment which could be used for repression, and deny visas to senior Yugoslav officials. They also demanded that Belgrade start talks on self rule with the Albanian-dominated province of Kosovo within ten days, or face a freeze on Yugoslav assets abroad. Russia agreed to halt sales of arms and deny visas, but held off imposing financial sanctions until the next Contact Group meeting at the end of this month.

Belgium in deep water over safety inspection campaign

BELGIUM’s refusal to spend 500,000 ecu on additional maritime safetyinspectors is undermining the EU’s campaign to drive rogue shipowners fromthe high seas.

DIFFERENT VOICES

“It would be dangerous if the political classes and public opinion wereovercome by a syndrome of relief. No one can think about abandoningmonetary rigour.” Italian Foreign Minister Lamberto Dini warning againstcomplacency after his government published figures showing that Italy’sbudget deficit had dipped below the magic 3%-of-gross-domestic-product lineas required to qualify for the single currency.

THE MONTH AHEAD

13 March – 7 April 1998Friday 13 March

Union to review its anti-dumping policy

THE bad news for Europe’s trading partners is that the EU is the world’s second most important user of anti-dumping procedures to protect its manufacturers against cheap imports.

Markets look to the next horizon

REGIONALISM versus globalism. When these two trade-opening approaches are mentioned, they are nearly always presented in this way: as conflicting and mutually exclusive.

Call for clear rules in eastern applicants

AS THE EU prepares to greet the first wave of new members from the East, business leaders are calling for urgent action to ensure Union trade rules are securely put in place.

THE MONTH AHEAD

6 March – 9 April 1998Friday 6 March

Combined effort to stem the tide of pollution

AS THE countries around the Black Sea attempt to come up with a commonapproach for revitalising their respective economies, the region remainsone of the world’s worst environmental disaster areas.

Banking on trade and development in the region

WITHIN the next few weeks, the Black Sea will have its own regionalinvestment bank.

27 February – 7 April 1998Friday 27 February
